title: Stock Funds Felt the Tech Pain in April
sub_head: The average U.S.-stock fund fell 8.6% and is down 14.1% so far this year
body:
Unplugged.
Tech stocks absorbed a long-awaited decline in April, damaging mutual funds and exchange-traded funds that had enjoyed their run-up. Some investors hope itâ€™s just a needed pause after a strong run for stocks of software, social-media and other tech companies that sent growth-stock funds soaring. As April ended, the tech-focused Nasdaq Composite Index had logged its weakest month since 2008: down 13%.
